claims.claim: Mental health issues can lead to interactions with law enforcement.
claims.quote: people with mental issues will call some of them returning citizens or should be in there because of some of the things that they were doing.

claims.claim: Children living with adults who have mental health issues may learn and mimic these behaviors.
claims.quote: The kid is learning this behavior and they think it's normal because that's the only behavior they see

claims.claim: Mental health problems can manifest in behaviors that seem rational until they suddenly do not.
claims.quote: It's a very thin line, right? A very thin line. So somebody can talk to you, you not even know that. They're in another reality, you not know because it's making sense what they're saying until it doesn't make sense.

claims.claim: Children exposed to adults with unchecked mental health issues are at risk of incarceration later in life.
claims.quote: What happens is when they're out here exhibiting what they've been taught, where do they end up in jail?

claims.claim: Circumstances categorized as emergencies by individuals with mental health issues can challenge emergency services.
claims.quote: I remember doing putting in a home invasion call... And they're like, leave. And I said, what are they saying? They're not saying anything. Like, what are they doing? They're watching tv.

claims.claim: Having children in the care of adults with severe mental health issues poses safety and developmental risks.
claims.quote: How can we allow kids to stay in the house with someone who has checks out a reality?

claims.claim: Families dealing with mental health crises need comprehensive support to prevent harmful cycles.
claims.quote: All of these things is like a domino effect.
